New Records: Dhananjaya de Silva scored 66 not out, the highest score in the match for Sri Lanka.
Key Match Events: Dhananjaya de Silva sealed the win with a boundary to ensure Sri Lanka's victory with 9 balls remaining.
Rashid Khan and Mujeeb Ur Rahman were the key bowlers for Afghanistan, but Sri Lanka's clinical performance was decisive.
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan elected to bat first after winning the toss.
Sri Lanka's bowlers maintained pressure throughout the innings, limiting Afghanistan's scoring options.
Post-Match Reflections: Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi expressed frustration at their inability to capitalize on good starts and slow pitch conditions.
Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka praised Dhananjaya de Silva's performance and highlighted the team's consistency.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 32nd match of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Group 1.
Wanindu Hasaranga was named Player of the Match for his impactful all-round performance.
Others: The match was held at the Brisbane Cricket Ground, known as the Gabba.
Umpires Ahsan Raza, Rod Tucker, and Nitin Menon officiated the match.
